>From: "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@...>

>John,  1500 generations with no improvement is a pretty good
>indication it won't get anywhere.

Well, here's the thing.  For a 7x7 input and a 8x8 output, they (who did 
this before using back propagation) required about 30-40 hidden nodes in 
order to do 4x enlargement.  That's a lot of topology, and it takes a while 
to evolve a lot of topology.  What I'm asking it to do is even more 
complicated, which means it will probably require even more topology.  So I 
imagine I should expect it to take a while to evolve.

This project might be a prime example of where modularity is required.  I 
need one network to form a model of the input pixels, and another to 
facilitate querying that model.  Trying to evolve them together might be a 
losing proposition, because there isn't a smooth fitness hill to climb.

Maybe I could ask it to JUST recreate its pixel inputs without recreating 
anything in between.  That way the network is forced to evolve such that it 
can accept those four inputs and make something of them.  From there, there 
might be a smooth evolutionary path to enlargement.

I think I will go ahead and try giving every node a connection to the BIAS 
input and see what kind of difference that makes, too...  Seems like it 
would never hurt, it could only help.

-- John
